channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Insurance Industry Is Winning a Fight to Kill New Protections for Retirement Savers
item.description: A Labor Department rule is forecast to curb commissions on annuities sharply. The products are sold as a way to convert retirement savings including an IRA into an often-guaranteed income stream that can carry hefty charges.

item.title: ‘You’re not stupid enough to have to work in a place like this’: It’s time to give fast-food workers some respect. Could you do what they do?
item.description: A 39-year-old woman in Parma, Ohio was sentenced to two months working in a fast-food restaurant after throwing a hot bowl in a Chipotle worker’s face.

item.title: Big Food Would Benefit from Private Ownership
item.description: Mars’s bid for Kellanova highlights the benefits of being out of public view.

item.title: ‘I fear a storm is coming’: I’m nervous about November’s election and another recession. Should I move my money to cash and gold?
item.description: “I’ve considered parking it all in a location such as Grand Cayman.”

item.title: Stocks Claw Back Losses After Global Selloff
item.description: The Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq advanced after the Nikkei jumped 10%.

item.title: CVS’s stock drops as the healthcare-benefits business continues to hurt profits
item.description: CVS’s CEO said the company is “taking action” to address its challenges, including making leadership changes in some business segments.

item.title: KKR Founders Sued for Allegedly Getting Giant Payday for No Work
item.description: The lawsuit adds to legal scrutiny of arcane tax deals benefiting private-equity heavyweights.

item.title: Warner Music’s stock rises after profit matches estimates despite small revenue miss
item.description: Warner Music Group Corp.’s stock rose 3% premarket Wednesday, after the company matched profit estimates for the second quarter, offsetting a small revenue miss.

item.title: Why Everyone Needs a 'Digital Death-Cleaning' Plan
item.description: Nobody wants to leave heirs a confusing collection of files they can’t open, accounts they can’t access and assets they can’t locate.

item.title: New York Times says new digital-only subscribers helped profit rise 41%
item.description: News-media provider added 300,000 digital-only subscribers, bringing the number to a total of 10.84 million

item.title: Google and Apple Can Afford to Play Long Game After Antitrust Ruling
item.description: They have a strong common cause to protect the billions of dollars Google pays Apple every year to keep its search engine on the iPhone, though the arrangement is looking a little more dicey.

item.title: IHOP parent Dine Brands’ stock falls after revenue miss and lowered sales guidance
item.description: The parent of Applebee’s and IHOP had a better-than-expected profit in its latest quarter but revenue fell short.

item.title: A Volatility Storm Is Buffeting Markets. When Will It Clear?
item.description: Though much of the stock selloff is likely caused by a reversal in speculative trades, rather than deeper problems, the market won’t immediately go back to normal.

item.title: These sectors thrive in ‘deep recession’ scenario where yields fall and spreads widen, says Citigroup
item.description: As recession fears build on Wall Street, Citigroup strategists have put together the sectors that would do best in such an environment.

item.title: China Evergrande Aims to Recover $6 Billion From Executives, Others
item.description: The heavily indebted Chinese developer said it is seeking to claw back the money from seven individuals, including founder Hui Ka Yan, his ex-wife, a former chief executive and a former chief financial officer.

item.title: Oil prices lifted as stocks extend bounce and traders eye Middle East tensions
item.description: Oil futures rose Wednesday, finding support as the stock market continued its recovery from a global rout that had served to pull down commodity prices.

item.title: What to Do With Your Money if You're Worried About the Market
item.description: The standard advice is to do nothing, but there are some exceptions.

item.title: Shopify’s stock soars as company bucks mixed spending signals with earnings beat
item.description: Shopify posted a big beat on free cash flow for the second quarter.

item.title: Is This 1987 All Over Again? What's Driving the Market Meltdown?
item.description: Monday’s wild day in markets showed that nervous investors were overextended.

item.title: These stocks are likely to soar when the bull market rebounds
item.description: Stocks that lose the most often make a strong recovery once market liquidity returns.

item.title: Unraveling Trades Fuel Global Market Rout
item.description: The unwinding of some of Wall Street’s most popular trades intensified, sending stock indexes sharply lower and walloping tech shares. The Dow industrials fell more than 1,000 points.

item.title: What Is the Yen Carry Trade?
item.description: The unwinding of a popular investment strategy is sending ripples through global markets.

item.title: Outages Plague Trading Platforms During the Stock-Market Selloff
item.description: Customers at Charles Schwab, Vanguard and Fidelity reported problems logging into accounts.

item.title: Stocks Are Crashing---That's a Great Reason to Sit Tight
item.description: There are some genuine concerns at the root of this market selloff. But many other factors seem to be at play too.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei Suffers Worst Day Since 1987, Hit by U.S. Concerns
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average had its worst day since 1987, falling 12.4% in a frenzy of selling triggered by disappointing economic data in the U.S. and a surge in the Japanese yen.

item.title: Green-Energy Flops Revive Bets on Natural Gas
item.description: European energy giants Shell and BP are sticking to their core business as clean-energy investments make slow progress.

item.title: Are Banks Sweeping Dud Property Loans Under the Rug?
item.description: New accounting rules should give investors an earlier warning, but surprises are cropping up and there could be more to come.

item.title: 2024's Most Popular Trades Are Unraveling
item.description: Some on Wall Street worry the Fed waited too long to cut rates.

item.title: Mars in Advanced Talks to Buy Cheez-It, Eggo Maker Kellanova
item.description: The deal would be one of the largest of the year and could come together imminently.

item.title: Stock Funds Are Up 12.6% in 2024
item.description: It was another positive month for stock funds, but bond funds are drawing big-time cash. Also: A flashback to the 20th anniversary of the Google IPO.
